page.title: 09CONSERVATION HARDWICK AREA
page.content: A number of people in the area support conservation actively.1 farmer hopes to re-establish hedges round all his fields achieving this by planting young trees both deciduous & evergreen & also by retaining selfgrown saplings The trees are planted in hedges,clumps in corners of fields or in a small wood;they are hand weeded,watered & protected,records are kept & photos taken.Other farmers & landowners have also planted trees or grown them for seed,improved derelict areas making them more attractive to wildlife;1 has a thriving colony of Rudd in his moat & has also introduced Carp.On 1 farm pheasants,French & English Partridges are reared,100 pheasants are released annually.There are a number of marked footpaths,some farmers are willing to reopen unused paths except where grazing animals would be disturbed.
